headline.main: BROOKLYN NEWS.; Taxes for 1861. IMPORTANT REPORT OF THE SPECIAL COMMITTEE.

docs.lead_paragraph: An adjourned meeting of the Joint Board of Aldermen and Supervisors was held in the Common Council Chamber last evening. The Special Committee, to whom was referred the Annual Statement of the Mayor of the several sums of money deemed necessary to be raised by tax for the various purposes authorized by the charter to carry on the City Government, submitted a report.

headline.main: THE REVOLUTION IN SOUTHERN ITALY.; What Next? The Neapolitan Concessions How they are Received The Sicilian War.

docs.snippet: Hardly had the Metropolitan tympanums recovered from the incessant din of Japanese receptions, Fourth of July parades, Camp Scott festivities and Chicago Zouave drills, than a new sensation appears in the arrival of the Savannah Republican Blues.

headline.main: OUR MILITARY VISITORS.; Arrival of the Savannah Blues. WHO THEY ARE AND HOW THEY LOOK--THEIR RECEPTION BY THE CITY GUARD--ARRANGEMENTSFOR THEIR ENTERTAINMENT.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hardly had the Metropolitan tympanums recovered from the incessant din of Japanese receptions, Fourth of July parades, Camp Scott festivities and Chicago Zouave drills, than a new sensation appears in the arrival of the Savannah Republican Blues.

docs.snippet: The United States Mail steamship De Soto, J. JOHNSTON, Commander, from Havana, arrived at this port at 2 o'clock P.M. yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship De Soto, J. JOHNSTON, Commander, from Havana, arrived at this port at 2 o'clock P.M. yesterday.

headline.main: Meeting of the Republican State Central Committee.; THE STATE CONVENTION TO BE CALLED FOR THE 22D OF AUGUST, AT SYRACUSE.

docs.snippet: Owing to certain misrepresentations of the public conduct of Gen. DEGOLLADO, the Liberal Chief, which have recently appeared in some of the newspapers, several gentlemen sojourning in this city, and thoroughly acquainted with Mexican affairs, have...
docs.lead_paragraph: Owing to certain misrepresentations of the public conduct of Gen. DEGOLLADO, the Liberal Chief, which have recently appeared in some of the newspapers, several gentlemen sojourning in this city, and thoroughly acquainted with Mexican affairs, have prepared a brief history of events since January, 1858, which relieves him from all uncharitable imputations, and shows him to be a true patriot, constantly striving, amid accumulated difficulties, for the welfare of his distracted country.
